title: 105_hr4213
content: The "Savings and Investment Relief Act of 1998" may be cited as the short title. Transaction fees are addressed in the Act. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to include a limitation on transaction fees for national securities exchanges and associations. The Commission will set a cap on fees based on sales of securities, with total fee payments not exceeding $150,000,000 in fiscal year 1999 and $155,000,000 in fiscal year. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 sets limitations on transaction fees for national securities exchanges and associations. The fee caps are set at $155,000,000 in fiscal year 2000, increasing annually to $210,000,000 in fiscal year 2006 and beyond. The Commission will publish fee limitations annually in the Federal Register. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 mandates fee adjustments for national securities exchanges and associations, providing reductions for all market participants. The Commission sets limitations on off-exchange trades fees annually based on sales volume. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 mandates fee adjustments for national securities exchanges and associations, providing reductions for all market participants. Fee payments are capped at specific amounts for each fiscal year from 1999 to 2005 to ensure they do not exceed certain limits. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 mandates fee adjustments for national securities exchanges and associations, providing reductions for all market participants. Fee payments are capped at specific amounts for each fiscal year from 2006 onwards. The Commission is required to publish fee limitations annually in the Federal Register and report the total amount of fees collected to Congress. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires fee adjustments for national securities exchanges and associations, with fee payments capped annually. The Commission must report fee collections to Congress, and in cases of insufficient fees, Appropriations Acts may increase fee limitations to cover the Commission's budget authority.
